I admit, for the longest time after I was diagnosed with diabetes, I continued to eat & drink whatever I wanted. But I eventually (about 6 months ago) changed my diet. I cut out sodas & as much fattening foods as possible. I increased my fruit & water intake, & I started walking at least 20 minutes every couple days. At my heaviest, I was at 311. I'm now at 275. Admittedly still on the heavy side, but just as it didn't take me a day to gain the weight, it will take me longer than a day to shed the weight.My doctor's office was in transition (firing & hiring) &, as a result, only had 1 doctor available. I went to the office but was told by the nurse in charge that unless it was life-threatening, I should call back to see when they'd have more than 1 doctor available. I called today to schedule an appointment & was told that they'd give me a call back. Because I don't have health insurance, & this office allows me to be on a sliding scale (much lower payments), I'm somewhat out of options. I can either be seen at this office & still provide for my family or I can go to the ER & possibly end up late on other bills. I'm not expecting to find a "cure" as you put it; rather, I'm wondering if anyone has experienced these symptoms before or could help lead me in the right direction. Thank you for your input.

question: About 3-4 weeks ago, I came down with what I thought was just a common cold. But then it got worse - I had diarrhea, vomiting, and conjunctivitis. A few days later, I noticed my calf muscles had tightened, feeling almost as if in suspended cramp. A few days after that, I noticed I had joint pain in my knees. This quickly spread to the rest of my joints (I.e. ankles, toes, wrists, fingers) simultaneously. I was diagnosed with diabetes last year, & I was started on a birth control pill to regulate my cycle (I had been losng a lot of blood which resulted in anemia & iron deficiency. Because of this, I had to have a blood transfusion). Now, aside from a tickle in my throat, I only have joint pain. I've been taking 800MG of Ibuprofen which seems to help tremendously, but what could be causing this inflammation in my joints?
title: Conjunctivitis/Joint Pain
